item.title: Introduction to allocators and arenas
item.description: Lately, I have been playing around with the implementation of custom allocators and arenas to replace native allocations on my C++ projects. Wow! Stop right there, Miguel. This line already deserves some introductions! Let’s talk about allocators. Crash course on allocations To keep this brief, I will assume that we have some experience with C++ and heap allocation (malloc and new). An allocation is when we request a pointer to a block of memory of a specified size.
